questions.question: What are two cables that are used to connect a computer to a printer? (Choose two.)
answer: serial
FireWire

questions.question: What are two functions of a print server? (Choose two.)
options: provide print resources to all connected client computers
store print jobs in a queue until the printer is ready
ensure that the connected client computers have up-to-date printer drivers
store backups of documents sent to the printer
provide uninterrupted power to the printer
answer: provide print resources to all connected client computers
store print jobs in a queue until the printer is ready

questions.question: What are two methods to connect to a printer wirelessly? (Choose two.)
answer: IEEE 802.11 standards
Bluetooth

questions.question: What are two probable causes for printer paper jams? (Choose two.)
answer: high humidity
the wrong type of paper

questions.question: Which factor affects the speed of an inkjet printer?
options: the desired quality of the image
the size of printer power supply
the cost of the inkjet cartridges
questions.answer: the desired quality of the image

questions.question: What is a characteristic of thermal inkjet nozzles?
options: The heat creates a bubble of steam in the chamber.
Heat is applied to the ink reservoir of each nozzle.
The vibration of the crystal controls the flow of ink.
A charge is applied to the printhead.
questions.answer: The heat creates a bubble of steam in the chamber.

questions.question: In laser printing, what is the name of the process of applying toner to the latent image on the drum?
questions.answer: developing

questions.question: What is the purpose of the Additional Drivers button in the Sharing tab of the Printer Properties?
options: to add additional drivers for other operating systems
to add additional drivers for other printers in the network
to add additional drivers for duplex printing
to add additional drivers for other printers connected to the computer
questions.answer: to add additional drivers for other operating systems

questions.question: A Windows 7 computer has several printers configured in the Control Panel Devices and Printers window. Which printer will the computer choose to be the first option for printing?
options: the printer that is set as the default printer
the software-based printer that is used to create PDF files
the software-based printer that is used to create XPS files
a manual selection, which is always needed
questions.answer: the printer that is set as the default printer

questions.question: Which type of print server provides the most functions and capabilities?
options: a print server that is implemented in software
questions.answer: a dedicated PC print server

questions.question: A user discovers that an inkjet color printer is printing different colors from those that are shown on the screen. What can be done to solve this problem?
questions.answer: Calibrate the printer.

questions.question: What is a characteristic of global and per-document options in print settings?
options: Global options take precedence over per-document options.
It is not possible to configure per-document options.
It is not possible to configure global options.
questions.answer: Per-document options override global options.

questions.question: After applying a solution to a printer problem, a technician restarts the printer and prints a test page. Which step of the troubleshooting process is the technician applying?
options: verifying the solution and system functionality
testing a theory to determine the cause of the problem
questions.answer: verifying the solution and system functionality

questions.question: A technician recorded that a new fuser roller unit was installed in a laser printer to solve a printing problem. Which step in the troubleshooting process did the technician just perform?
options: verifying the solution and system functionality
testing a theory to determine the cause of the problem
questions.answer: documenting findings, actions, and outcomes

questions.question: Which action supports an effective printer preventive maintenance program?
options: Reset the printer page counters if available.
Replace laser printer toner at set predetermined time intervals.
Clean inkjet print heads when they stop working.
Disconnect the printer from the power source when it is not in use.
questions.answer: Reset the printer page counters if available.

questions.question: How can the life of a thermal printer be extended?
options: Clean the heating element regularly with isopropyl alcohol.
Clean the inside of the printer with a vacuum cleaner with a HEPA filter.
Keep the paper dry in a low humidity environment.
Wipe the outside of the printer with a damp cloth.
questions.answer: Clean the heating element regularly with isopropyl alcohol.

questions.question: In Windows 8, what must be configured to enable one user to share a USB-connected printer with another user on the same network?
questions.answer: File and printer sharing

questions.question: The users on a LAN are reporting that computers respond slowly whenever high resolution photographs are being printed on the color laser printer. What would be the cause of this problem?
options: The printer does not have enough memory to buffer an entire photograph.
The printer is not configured for duplex printing.
The paper is not adequate for photograph printing.
The printer is not configured for the proper paper orientation.
questions.answer: The printer does not have enough memory to buffer an entire photograph.

questions.question: A technician is installing a printer that will be directly connected to a computer. Why does the technician not connect the printer initially during the installation process?
options: The printer needs to be configured first.
The OS of the workstation needs to be updated first.
The printer driver might need to be installed first before the printer is connected.
The Microsoft download site needs to be searched first for the printer driver.
questions.answer: The printer driver might need to be installed first before the printer is connected.

questions.question: Which statement describes a printer driver?
options: It is the interface in Windows that identifies a unique printer attached to the workstation.
It is cache inside a printer that stores documents to be printed in a queue.
It is software that converts a document into the format that a printer can understand.
It is the configuration code that is sent to a printer to identify the operating system of the workstation.
questions.answer: It is software that converts a document into the format that a printer can understand.

questions.question: What type of connection would be used to connect a printer directly to the network?
questions.answer: Ethernet

questions.question: What mechanism is used in a laser printer to permanently fuse the toner to the paper?
questions.answer: heat

questions.question: What corrective action would a technician take in response to a print spooler error?
questions.answer: restart the print spooler

questions.question: What corrective action should be taken if a printer is printing faded images?
questions.answer: replace the toner cartridge

questions.question: What would cause an inkjet printer to fail to print any pages?
options: The printer software is set to toner save.
The printer ribbon is worn out.
The printer is loaded with a paper type other than photo paper.
questions.answer: The ink cartridge is empty.

questions.question: A user tells a technician that the printer does not respond to attempts to print a document. The technician attempts to print a document and the printer does not output any pages. The technician notices that the printer LCD display is blank and unlit. What is most likely the problem?
options: The screen contrast is too low.
The printer is not turned on.
The printer is out of ink.
questions.answer: The printer is not turned on.

questions.question: A technician is complaining about the following printer issue: The toner is not fusing to the paper. What are two possible causes of this issue? (Choose two.)
options: The paper might be incompatible with the printer.
A test page was never printed.
The laser printer is emitting too much radiation.
The printer lid has not been closed securely.
answer: The toner cartridge is defective.
The paper might be incompatible with the printer.

questions.question: A librarian is complaining about the following printer issue: My impact printer produces faded or light characters. What are two possible causes of this issue? (Choose two.)
options: The ribbon may be worn out.
The printer does not have enough RAM.
The wrong printer type has been selected.
The laser printer is emitting too much radiation.
answer: The ribbon may be worn out.
The ribbon may be damaged.

questions.question: A teacher is complaining about the following printer issue: The paper is creased after printing. What are two possible causes of this issue? (Choose two.)
options: The paper-feed tray might not be firmly adjusted against the edges of the printer.
The paper might be loaded incorrectly.
The printer has been installed on the wrong port.
The wrong printer type has been selected.
The laser printer is emitting too much radiation.
answer: The paper-feed tray might not be firmly adjusted against the edges of the printer.
The paper might be loaded incorrectly.

questions.question: A receptionist is complaining about the following printer issue: The print queue seems to be functioning properly, but the printer does not print. What are two possible causes of this issue? (Choose two.)
options: There is a bad cable connection.
The printer has an error such as out of paper, out of toner, or paper jam.
The wrong printer type has been selected.
The laser printer is emitting too much radiation.
answer: There is a bad cable connection.
The printer has an error such as out of paper, out of toner, or paper jam.

questions.question: A photographer is complaining about the following printer issue: The printer issues a “Document failed to print” message. What are two possible causes of this issue? (Choose two.)
options: A cable is loose or disconnected.
The printer is no longer shared.
The wrong printer type has been selected.
The laser printer is emitting too much radiation.
answer: A cable is loose or disconnected.
The printer is no longer shared.

questions.question: A reporter is complaining about the following printer issue: The paper jams when the printer is printing. What are two possible causes of this issue? (Choose two.)
options: The humidity could be high and that causes the paper to stick together.
The laser printer is emitting too much radiation.
The wrong printer type has been selected.
The printer lid has not been closed securely.
answer: The printer could be dirty.
The humidity could be high and that causes the paper to stick together.

questions.question: A manager is complaining about the following printer issue: The ink printer is printing blank pages. What are two possible causes of this issue? (Choose two.)
options: The printer is out of ink or toner.
The printer is using the wrong cable.
The wrong printer type has been selected.
The laser printer is emitting too much radiation.
answer: The print head is clogged.
The printer is out of ink or toner.

questions.question: A technician is complaining about the following printer issue: The print appears faded on the paper. What are two possible causes of this issue? (Choose two.)
options: The paper might be incompatible with the printer.
A test page was never printed.
The room temperature is above normal.
The printer is using the wrong cable.
answer: The toner cartridge is low.
The paper might be incompatible with the printer.

questions.question: A librarian is complaining about the following printer issue: The printer control panel displays no image. What are two possible causes of this issue? (Choose two.)
options: The contrast of the screen may be set too low.
The printer is not turned on.
The room temperature is above normal.
The printer does not have enough RAM.
The printer is using the wrong cable.
answer: The contrast of the screen may be set too low.
The printer is not turned on.

questions.question: A teacher is complaining about the following printer issue: The paper is creased after printing. What are two possible causes of this issue? (Choose two.)
options: The paper-feed tray might not be firmly adjusted against the edges of the printer.
The paper might be loaded incorrectly.
Print jobs are being sent to the wrong printer.
The room temperature is above normal.
The printer is using the wrong cable.
answer: The paper-feed tray might not be firmly adjusted against the edges of the printer.
The paper might be loaded incorrectly.

questions.question: All documents printed by the laser printer in the branch office have ghost or shadow images appearing on the paper. What should the technician do to resolve the issue?
options: Configure the printer for duplex printing.
Check the vibration of the crystals.
questions.answer: Replace the drum.

questions.question: An office assistant in a law firm is trying to print many large legal documents but is getting “memory overload” error messages from the printer. What should the technician do to resolve the issue?
options: Add more memory to the printer.
Check the vibration of the crystals.
questions.answer: Add more memory to the printer.

questions.question: A reporter is trying to print several high resolution photographs but the color laser printer is going extremely slowly. What should the technician do to resolve the issue?
options: Add more RAM to the printer.
Check the vibration of the crystals.
questions.answer: Add more RAM to the printer.

questions.question: A reporter is trying to print several high resolution photographs but the color laser printer is going extremely slowly. What should the technician do to resolve the issue?
options: Add more RAM to the printer.
questions.answer: Add more RAM to the printer.

questions.question: A new printer has just been installed deep in a mine. When test pages are printed, the paper constantly jams. What should the technician do to resolve the issue?
options: Move the printer to a less-humid location.
questions.answer: Move the printer to a less-humid location.

questions.question: A new printer has just been installed deep in a mine. When test pages are printed, the paper constantly jams. What should the technician do to resolve the issue?
options: Move the printer to a less-humid location.
questions.answer: Move the printer to a less-humid location.

questions.question: A user complains that recently every printed document has vertical lines and streaks on the paper. What should the technician do to resolve the issue?
options: Distribute the toner more evenly within the cartridge.
questions.answer: Distribute the toner more evenly within the cartridge.

questions.question: A school is installing a new shared printer but the printer is not showing up on the list of available printers. What should the technician do to resolve the issue?
options: Manually add the printer IP address.
questions.answer: Manually add the printer IP address.

questions.question: A school is installing a new shared printer but the printer is not showing up on the list of available printers. What should the technician do to resolve the issue?
options: Manually add the printer IP address.
Check the vibration of the crystals.
questions.answer: Manually add the printer IP address.

questions.question: Employees are complaining that they send print jobs to a newly installed printer but the print jobs never print. What should the technician do to resolve the issue?
options: The printer is connected to the wrong port. Modify the port.
Check the vibration of the crystals.
questions.answer: The printer is connected to the wrong port. Modify the port.

questions.question: A small company is moving towards sharing printers to reduce the number of printers used within the company. The technician has security concerns. What security risk is associated with sharing a printer?
questions.answer: data privacy

questions.question: A technician is programming a wireless printer to connect to the wireless network and communicate wirelessly with nearby devices. Which two wireless modes are used for wireless printer connectivity? (Choose two.)
answer: ad hoc
infrastructure

questions.question: Users have noticed that the colors on their printed documents are different from the colors that they see on their computer screens. What should the technician do to resolve the issue?
options: Configure the printer for duplex printing.
questions.answer: Calibrate the printer.

questions.question: A technician has just completed a preventive maintenance on the department printer. Users are now complaining that the printer is no longer available. What should the technician do to resolve the issue?
options: Check that the printer is plugged into a power source.
Configure the printer for duplex printing.
questions.answer: Check that the printer is plugged into a power source.

questions.question: Employees of a small business are complaining that the printer is printing faded images. What should the technician do to resolve the issue?
options: Check the vibration of the crystals.
questions.answer: Replace the toner cartridge.

questions.question: A user is complaining that the printer is printing pages with no image on them. What should the technician do to resolve the issue?
options: Check the vibration of the crystals.
questions.answer: Replace the toner cartridge.

questions.question: A manager is complaining that the toner is coming off the pages printed by the laser printer. What should the technician do to resolve the issue?
options: Check the vibration of the crystals.
questions.answer: Replace the fuser.
